data_structures: 3D array (for visited states: row, col, mask)
algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) with state represented by (row, col, mask, energy).
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum moves to collect all litter on a grid with obstacles, reset points, and limited energy.
problem_summary_technical: BFS on a state space (row, col, bitmask of collected litter, current energy) to find the shortest path to collect all litter.
key_insights: The state must include the bitmask of collected litter to track progress.
Energy management is crucial; reset areas ('R') replenish energy.
BFS guarantees finding the minimum number of moves.
